ftbquests.chapter.adventures_in_abydos.q: I hope the sand doesn't get in your machines.
One step closer to home...
A new world!
The core component for crafting all components for &4UHV&r.
An element used for alloys that can make excellent mechanical parts.
An alloy used for sturdy mechanical components.
A small computer that can regulate mechanisms.
An alloy that is extremely proficient in guiding electromagnetic fields.
A remnant of nuclear decay, possibly telling a story of what happened to this world.
A new alloy that can control the flow of electricity with extreme precision.
A new machine that can find treasures among the rubble.
1st &4&oUltimate&r Multiblock
This machine mixes a liquid with 2 catalysts to put it in a more activated form.
With these 2 machines you can massively increase the amount of Akreyrium you produce.
More &4&oUltimate&r Multiblocks
A weird fluid, that has some interesting properties making it necessary for more advanced machines.
Utopian Akreyrium

By inputting a bacteria you are able to breed then so they multiply and get mutated copies so you can try to find the exact rates you are looking for. Higher mutability means more variance in its output.
This is how you can extract the bacteria to get the resources you desire
A mechanism that can create rotation with large amounts of force.
This machine can do 3 things.
1. Reactivate the Dormant Bacteria to a usable form
2. Mutate bacteria so that it may have a new affinity
3. Mutate bacteria so that it may be a new type
With all of this and the breeder (more information there) you should be able to get the exact type of bacteria you desire.
Go Explore the Scattered Temples of Abydos to find the things you are searching for.
You might even find a &ltalisman&r powerful enough to stop the sands of Abydos from eroding you...
Scattered Temples
A bacteria that is in a dormant state. Why was this stored with treasures?
Otherworldly Biology
Awoken Bacteria. These come in all kinds of types and seem to produce some familiar liquids.
Bacterial Colonies
Find all the fragments to uncover hidden knowledge
Runic Tablet Fragments
Soon more advanced technology is unveiled
A new Stellarium alloy mixed with materials not normally found on your home isle.
The &2UEV&r superconductor, can hold 256 amps in a 1x wire
A Fusion Reactor that can do parallels. Long gone are the days of excessive Fusion spam, now all you need to do is figure out how to efficiently wallshare these.
Auxiliary Fusion Reactors are special in that they can parallel using &6Absolute &3Parallel&r hatches. (Placed on the interior side of the controller)
This beauty can harvest colossal amounts of air at once, and then also automatically distill it. Without a doubt, this multiblock is a must for getting to Ancient Gate.
A mechanism that can do precise movements with directives.
A computer that can read data from a Draconic Coordinate Core.
The core of an Ancient Stargate.
This can accurately detect and use Chevrons to lock on planets far beyond Abydos.
And here we go again, more Ring Blocks
Though this time, much stronger
These Chevrons can lock in coordinates with far more precision then the previous generation.
A Chevron that can hold data for more advanced destinations.
So this is what makes the Gates Beyond Comprehension....
A core with the ability to find the smallest and largest traces of planets all over the Galaxy
The path to the hellfires of the Nether, inscribed on a piece of whispering gemstone.
The path to the shattered void of the End, inscribed on a piece of whispering gemstone.
The gateway to the cold and lifeless abyss, and the burning fires of hell.
&oJust a recommendation, but don't take any valuable items with you the first time.
The Ancient Gate
A valve that can measure the tiniest amounts of fluid and accurately dose them.
Mutate and Breed Bacteria to fit your needs and help you gather all the hydrocarbons you could need.
Cheaper HydroCarbons
A core that can detect the smallest amounts of matter inside the vast nothingness of space.
A core that can feel the immense energy of burning flames all across the galaxy.
This data disk can store so much data that you could put all human DNA in it.
The start of your wildest dreams, a dragon based circuit board.
The new tier of coils in Abydos, so get ready to replace your old ones.
Another tier of PIC Wafers, used for some incredible Abydos technology.
UEPIC Chips
Runes engraved on blocks to allow for them to exert power on placed blocks.
Runic Engraved Casings
Multi-layered runes, carrying the power of all that went into crafting them.
Multi-Engraved Runic Plating
A machine that can engrave runes on top of each other using lost Abydos technology.
A magnetic field controller.
Even more runes.
Advanced Engraved Runes
An array of Chevrons that can store more complex data.
You can drill this up just like Oil.
Gritty Akreyrium
A passive Heat Sink with actual good cooling.
Better Research Heat Sink
Positioner
The Maker of Gates applauds you and bestoys upon you their recognition.
This is most definitly looking at you.
Ok now these rates are getting insane
1024x Parallel Hatch
Remember how regular &3Parallel&r hatches are complex and care about maxing out amperage and your overclocks. Ya forget all of that it's just that many more of a recipe at once.
(Only goes on special machines, does &4NOT&r replace your normal parallel hatch)
4x Absolute Parallel Hatch
By using the exotic gas collector you can do all of Air Distillation in 1 step.
Furthermore you are able to collect airs from exotic dimensions.
Cheaper Gasses
A sturdy core that can precisely regulate it's inner working environment.

Scans indicate that the Nether is an inhospitable dimension due to intensive radioactive decay. This armor will help mitigate the effects. The Nether inhabitants might be hiding a &ltalisman&r capable of nullifying the effects of radiation...
Runic Infused Hazmat Armor
More information present in the Processing Lines (4,5,6) Chapter
Magma Processing
These Magmas need to a little more to break down.
Obtained from Crooksite, and holding &lIMMENSE&r importance when it comes to &o&nAkreyrium&r
A shard of the &5&l&o&mAbyss&r
Forged from echoes of a void and altered stars
It must be at the heart of something strong
A shard of the &4&l&o&mInferno&r
Forged from blinding flames and altered stars
It must be at the heart of something strong
Used to contain powers just within comprehention.
A refined Stargate Rod, infused with the power of the &5&o&lAbyss&r. Refined over and over.
Alone it is able to rip tears in the fabric of the endless void.
A refined Stargate Rod, infused with the power of the &4&o&lInferno&r. Refined over and over.
Alone it holds enough power to burn through the fabric of space
A Stargate Rod infused with the power of the &5&oAbyss&r, though not yet refined
A sturdy plating that can resist wear and tear from high stress machinery.
A Stargate Rod infused with the power of the &4&oInferno&r, though not yet refined
Have you ever wanted to process millions of items at once?
Well now you can.
Gravi-Stars &o&lCollapsed&r with even greater intensity.
Advanced Singularities
Have you ever thought that wires were a little... excessive. Well now they arent needed.
If you love using Converters, bad luck, after &aUEV&r that no longer becomes an as direct solution.
Read more about how wireless power works here
&lWireless Power&r Adds the Following for &3UV&f and &4Higher&f:&r
- Covers: Let your single blocks run from anywhere in the Dream Link's range (Beware of Overvolting)
- Hatches: All your regular hatches and the brand new addition of 64a Hatches
Wireless Covers and Hatches
Ruined Component Parts can be found as loot in various structures in Abydos.
By finding these ancient parts of technology and researching them, you can discover how to advance into &4UHV&r technology.
Ruined Component Parts
A way to bypass the needs of armor, a blessing of sorts.
Buried Tombs
Not much use on their own but they may hold the secret to stronger things
Ancient Armors
A controller that can precisely regulate energy transfer.
ftbquests.chapter.applied_energistics.qu: Terminals allow you to see what is happening inside your network, and interact with it.
We recommend instantly upgrading to a crafting terminal, as they are extremely convenient.
Patterns are the key to autocrafting with AE2.
They store the recipes that you want to craft, and when you put them in a pattern provider, AE2 will see how to craft that item.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest10: Better get used to it, as it will take a little bit until you can get better ones.
A &oBIG&r barrel that can scale with your power allowing you to barrel even harder.
Heavy Oil can alternatively be made in a Pyrolysed Oven
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest11: The new &6HV&r circuit can be upgraded into an &5EV&r circuit, allowing you to make upgrades to all your machines.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest13: Better Circuits means better Circuit boards
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest14: &6Auto Maintenance Hatch&r: Ever worry about needing maintenance, well now you never have to.
&3Configurable Maintenance Hatch&r: Make your machines faster at the sake of risking more maintenance issues, or make them slower to reduce the chance.
Maintenance hatches will always check if they incure maintenance which can take a toll on your game's performance at scale. Auto Maintenance Fixes this concern.

Alternatively the Configurable Maintenance can range from .9x time to 1.1x time. Meaning you can either add/subtract 10%% from a recipe time. Reducing long recipe times is very nice. Increasing Generator uptime is also very nice.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest15: &6HV&r Assembler, used for &6HV&r Energy Hatches and Upgrade Kits, along with SMD's for cheaper circuit crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest17: This chip is used to make &6HV&r energy hatches and transformers.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest18: The first upgrade to every circuit component. Is more resource efficent and gives more per craft.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest19: Will increase the power of anything thermal by 24x.
Lets you turn your RF into &6HV&r power.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest20: A crafting ingredient for items that need energy, and a battery that stores &6HV&r energy.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest21: Can be upgraded into a Large Autoclave soon.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest22: Armor with build in night vision and step assist.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest23: The Cleanroom is a structure that filters inside itself, allowing for a dust free environment to achieve more precise crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest24: &5EV&r Circuits give you access to the &6HV&r Circuit Assembler. I recommend putting this in your Cleanroom to save time.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest25: The end of the circuit upgrade chain will bring you into &9IV&r, bet you didnt expect that.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest26: Allows you to turn RF into &5EV&r power.
Oh ya and 64A converters exist from now on.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest27: &5EV&r superconductor, can hold 32 amps in a 1x cable.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest29: Nichrome is one of the first alloys requiring a Vacuum Freezer to cool down.
&6HV&r superconductor, can hold 16 amps on the 1x cable.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest30: 3rd tier of coils for your EBF to allow you to increase the heat even more. Will start making hot ingots more often.
It also gives you your first heat based Overclocks for Aluminium and Stainless Steel notably.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest32: Will increase the power of anything thermal by 48x. This is the final Upgrade Kit you can make for them.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest33: You should understand what this does already right?
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest34: This cools down your Hot Ingots better and faster then the Chemical Bath could ever hope to achieve.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest35: Used to turn &6HV&r machines into their &6Perfect Overclock&r multiblock variants
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest36: A very tall multiblock that allows you to distill one fluid into multiple others without having to choose like with the distillery.
Single block Distilleries can still be used but wont give you all products and can't be overclocked.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest37: More Information in the Resource Production Tab
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest38: Allows you to pump oil from the void. I don't know how that works out, but it does.
Better Drills do not drain chunks as much and work much faster.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest39: Allows you to scan your surrounding chunks for fluids.
Spoilers, its going to be oil.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest40: Mix Oil distillation byproducts with some hydrogen to clean them, allowing you to distill them further.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest41: Choose an oil byproduct and get it cracked to allow even further processing.
Taking some time to figure out which cracking method for what product is the best for you is recommended.
Note: Chemical Reactors can be used for cracking but are less efficient.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest42: I hope you like having many distillation towers.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest43: Another material that can be used to coat cables, is the most efficent resource wise.
Should now be easily craftable with oil distillation fully set up.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest44: Allows you to run your multiblocks off of pure &5EV&r power, or even overclock to &9IV&r.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest45: 4th tier of Coils for all your smelting needs.
This needs Ruthenium, which you get from the Platline, check it out in the "Processing Lines" chapter.
Almost as hot as an RTX
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest46: You are going to need a lot of this, just like every other main voltage material.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest47: Distilling each air type will give you access to a variety of diffent chemicals, all of which will be useful in one way or another.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest48: The best liquid for etching Circuit Boards.
We recommend switching out your &oAE2&r patterns to use this.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest49: This chip is used for making &5EV&r tier Energy Hatches and Transformers.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest50: You can use this in a Laser Engraver to make new chips, or make the old ones more efficiently.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest51: This hatch can do something called Speed Overclocking.
A Speed Overclock is a special kind of Overclocking, that makes your machine run recipes at the next tier of voltage.
However, unlike normal Overclock, it will not make the machine be able to do recipes at that higher tier.
As an example, a 4A &5EV&r Hatch will let a machine run at &9IV&r speed, but only do &5EV&r or lower recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest52: A 16A &5EV&r Energy Hatch will let a machine run at &dLuV&r speed, but only do &5EV&r or lower recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest53: Second tier of Boule. Can be used to make new types of chips as well as make older types more efficently.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest55: Aquired from Apatite or Monazite processing.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest57: Can be done with some fancy mixing or Mystical Agriculture.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest58: Can be done with some fancy mixing or Mystical Agriculture.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest59: The essence of the End, right in the palm of your hand.
A better tier of circuit assembler allowing you to make circuits faster and the &eMicrochip&r line which you will use for a while.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest60: The essence of the Nether, maybe it will bring some hot weather.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest63: Make some Endstone and get to processing it.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest64: Make some Netherack and get to processing it.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest65: Now you have &8PTFE&r, you can make one of the most useful multiblocks, the Large Chemical Reactor (LCR for short). You will have so many of these by the end of the pack.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest66: Better Circuits, Fasters Circuits, Cheaper Circuits, this is a big one.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest67: The final &6HV&r circuit. Like previous circuits, this has a cheaper recipe once you gain access to a new chip.
A multiblock that has two uses, either smelting normal items or creating alloys at an extreme rate.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest70: The spoils from the massive expoy processing line.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest71: A different way to make chips, by covering them in chemicals.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest73: These chips will be needed in almost every other circuit from now on, might want to keep a lot of these in stock.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest74: Lets you power your multiblocks with &9IV&r or overclock to &dLuv&r.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest75: &9IV&r Assembly Machine, used to make higher tier Coils and Energy Hatches. Can be upgraded into the Assembly Machine multiblock's controller.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest79: Lets you turn your RF into &9IV&r power.
This is the final version of the &bMV&r circuit, however just like the &7LV&r circuit, there is a cheaper recipe that unlocks later on.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest80: &9IV&r superconductor, can hold 64 amps in a 1x cable.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest82: This Chip is used in both &9IV&r and &dLuV&r Energy Hatches and Transformers as well as Assembly Line Casings.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest83: The second upgrade to all the Circuit Components. Very resource efficient and is needed for high tier Circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest84: These will give you the heat to make HSS-E and HSS-S ingots. Thats not going to get confusing at all.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest85: The first High Speed Steel available.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest87: A denser and harder form of HSS.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest89: This multiblock allows you to create even more complex alloys, but will give outputs in a molten form.
The ABS does both the mixing and smelting, and gives multiple units of ingots (144mb) as output because of this while only taking 75%% the time of their EBF counter-part.
You will need to cool the Molten Liquids in a Vacuum Freezer..
This is the final version of the &7LV&r circuit, however with a bit more progression you will gain access to an even cheaper recipe for it.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest90: The Nuclear Reactor can be used to transform &8Thorium&r into &aUranium&r and &2Uraniums&r into &cPlutoniums&r. Additionally it produces quite a lot of power.
Make sure that your dynamo hatches are big enough.
Oh, and maybe look into paralleling this thing when you can, you could say it causes quite the reaction.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest91: A gas that will be used a lot for Quantum Eyes and Stars.
We highly recommend setting Radon Loop up when you can, even if you have Ender Air distillation.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest97: Go Read About Lockable Fluid Hatches
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest98: More power storage options and batteries are shown.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest99: A type of reinforced Glass, with better sealing capacities.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.title: Automation Age
ftbquests.chapter.draconic_age_part_1.qu: Venture through the Ancient Stargate to discover the burning Nether.
Keep in mind that the Nether is a hostile environment, that might require some protective armor.

Scans indicate that the End is an even more inhospitable dimension due to entropic forces. This armor will help mitigate the effects. The End inhabitants might be hiding a &ltalisman&r capable of nullifying the effects of the abyss...
Venture through the Ancient Stargate to discover the hollow End.
Keep in mind that the End is an extremely dangerous environment, that will require some strong armor.
Vanquish the Ender Dragon, and free the End of the final dragon.
A new plasma, burning as hot as the Nether it originates from.
The abyss of the End holds pure levels of Entropy. Using this machine, you can harvest different Entropy states of Voidic Excression, and channel those towards technological advancement.
Draconic cells, carrying the powerful genes of the dragon race.
Channel their power into computing for new circuit technology or enhancing materials.
A processing unit combining Wetware technology with Draconic Brain Matter Cells to achieve breakthroughs in computing.
A mystical artifact. To find, locate shrines inside the nether.
Alloys that harness the power of the End, controlling the flow of energy.
A mystical infusion array that allows you to harness the powers of the end.
This multiblock requires the inputs to be placed in the correct order.
On the structure, the inputs are mapped according to the following images:
These are extremely charged abyssal alloys, that pave the way to &2UIV&r
The last tier of coils, brimming with Entropy, to fulfill all your smelting needs.
Deep in the crust of the nether lay great veins of Hellish Magma's, containing riches beyond ones wildest dreams.
Rare and expensive metals produced by processing the Hellish Magma's.
These stones are found in veins across the nether. Their mystical properties are needed to advance in casing technology.
&4Brimstone&r: is found near radioactive ore deposties
&3Cryostone&r: is found near conductive ore deposites
A new type of circuit assembler, that can not only produce better circuits, but also produce large amounts of basic circuits.
The fourth tier of fusion reactors, reaching over 1 Billion Kelvin.
A new fridge, for cooling down your ingots at higher speeds than ever.
A Sterile Maintenance Hatch, that will allow Sterile recipes to be run outside of a cleanroom.
A towering furnace, needing both fuel and power, to heat up materials to Mega-kelvins.
Is this what the milkies are used for?
A strong material needed for upgrading your infrastructure to &2UIV&r.
A parallel Alloy Blast Smelter, just in case it wasn't fast enough already.
A special material that holds mystical properties.
A new set of Alloys, forged from the flames of hell, ready for some industrial purposes.
Pick up some dragons breath during the fight.

Thank you for playing through this pack to its current state. A lot of time has been put in so that it was a unique and enjoyable experience. You are invited to come show off your accomplishment on our discord where we would love to hear what you thoughts about the pack.
Know why there is content that exist past this point it is in development and will be available in the next major release &l&9Theta&r&r
The content past this point is still in development, and will be available in the next major release, &l&9Theta&r&r.
Congratulations, for now this is the end of the content, though, if you join the discord you can often see what comes next.
You have completed the &5&lEta&r Version of &6Star Technology&r
A legendary feline, as energized as the flames from inferno.
A legendary feline, as eternal as the endless abyss.
A legendary feline, combining the heat and cold from two dimensions.
Need some more breath? Respawn the dragon.
Find an end city, and loot it.
Your new freezer will need better coolants, that surpass Helium in efficiency.
Now that you have Draconic Cells, you can start looping dragon's breath.
You have been granted protection in this place allowing you to forgo armor needs
You have been granted protection in this place allowing you to forgo armor needs
A wireless node with even larger area of impact.
A new tier of coils, harnessing the heat of the Nether in order to liquify even the strongest of materials.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest1.desc: The start of any skyblock pack. Who wood have guessed.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest10.des: It is recommended to make more dirt, before using up your entire starter island on this useful resource.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest11.des: The spoils of war when a string mesh is involved!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest12.des: With all the parts combined, you finally get your hands on your first &7LV&r circuit! It might be a good idea to make a bunch of these beforehand, to aid in the push for &7LV&r machines.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest14.des: Superconductors are lossless, meaning they won't lose power the farther they go. Always use them, when possible.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest15.des: Create's number one alloy, now with a better crafting ratio!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest16.des: Tired of needing two ingots per plate? The Mechanical Press lets you make plates for half the price early on!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest17.des: Extracting Latex from &lJungle Trees&r will be one of your first sources of rubber, after a bit of processing.
There are 2 ways to do this, either by placing &nArboreal Extractors&r around a Jungle Tree or by building the &nLatex Plantation&r multiblock.

&nNote&r: For the Latex Plantation you can use a wooden tap in the controller block, to use the better tap methods with a fuel and circuit you'll need a &8ULV&r Input Bus at a minimum. A Output Hatch can be placed on the back to automate further but isn't needed.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest18.des: Every greg master needs their toolbelt fully stocked to get their first machines ready. We recommend starting with Iron or Wrought Iron tools, or taking a look at the shop!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest19.des: Wrought Iron is made by sizzling iron on a campfire or stove.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest2.desc: Converters are essential for power transfer in this pack, as they are used to convert between EU and FE/RF. EU conversion is disabled for StarT, so you will need one of these whenever energy conversion is necessary. Keep in mind that &a4 FE/RF&r is equal to &61 EU&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest20.des: By heating a mixer, you can start to make your first alloys.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest21.des: By combining Rubber and Sulfur you can get cured rubber.
- This can be done by using a heated Create mixer.
- This can be done by using a Steam Alloy Smelter.
- This can be done by using a Cooking Pot with a campfire under it.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest22.des: Barrel transformations from Ex Nihilo have been disabled, and replaced with this beautiful machine!
It can soak, compost, and transform.
Be sure to choose the correct "&n&o&7Active Machine Mode&r", in the tab on the left of the UI.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest23.des: This bad boy will make you steel, albeit slowly. It isn't possible to automate sadly, but there is a better version on the horizon.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest24.des: It is recommended to use Wrought Iron for your steel processing, as it cuts the recipe time down by a noticeable amount.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest25.des: The most valuable alloy you can make right now, due to how much you will need for circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest26.des: Things are going to get sticky when using the Slitake Spores.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest27.des: Let's ignore the fact that this circuit board is just a plank of wood with some cables stuck to it with glue.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest28.des: Every circuit needs some resistors to stop it from blowing up in your face.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest29.des: Making glass isn't as simple as smelting sand now. First, you must grind down some Sand and Flint, mix it together into Glass Dust, and then give it a sizzle on a campfire.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest3.desc: Breaking leaves with a crook will drop Silkworms, which can be used on leaves to infest them. Sit back, watch the infestation spread, and reap the rewards with your crook.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest30.des: Let's put that steel to good use. You may want to hold off on making too many of these, at least before getting a lathe.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest31.des: By combining Witch Water and Sand together, you can make your first Soul Sand. You can either repeat this, or invest in a &3Soul Campfire&r to bulk haunt more Soul Sand and other materials.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest32.des: If you think the amount of different alloys are bad right now, then just you wait.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest33.des: Gold has a few uses for making Create components and machines, and is used for some alloys in &7LV&r
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest34.des: Now that you have some Brass, you can construct a new multiblock to process your ores further.
This will give you access to important resources, like gold and nickel.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest35.des: Pop this next to two water sources and you will never be thirsty again.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest36.des: Chuck your spare saplings into a Composter for some bonemeal. This will be necessary to obtain lava.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest37.des: Lava gives you access to cobblestone, which will contain everything you might ever need in life. You could also use it as a fuel, no one here is judging you.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest38.des: A staple of any GregTech pack. Upgrade your coal into coke, and get some tasty creosote to coat your planks in.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest39.des: Needing lots of crops quickly? Then this multiblock has your back!
You might get some good use out of this when making Bio Diesel.
You can optionally use busses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interacti directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest4.desc: Sieving is the only way to obtain resources early on. They can be automated, with a little cleverness.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest40.des: A larger barrel means faster recipes! Maybe this will help with that slime addiction...
You can optionally use busses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interacti directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest41.des: Automatic pebbles and lava? Sounds like a good use of your time to make a few of these.
You can optionally use busses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interacti directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest42.des: By combining dirt and gravel into Coarse Dirt and sieving it, you can double your dirt, and you even have a chance to get some of the gravel back!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest43.des: Create stresses me out, but without that nothing would move.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest44.des: Since Blazes are out of the question, a Basic Burner is needed to heat Basins.
Note that you can &6superheat&r Basic Burners with an Encased Fan at max &3RPM&r, though it will burn through fuel faster (32x).
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest45.des: Diesel Engines are a great way to generate large amounts of Stress Units for Create machines. Bio Diesel is one of the best fuel sources, but it requires some automating to keep a steady supply.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest46.des: Early fluid storage that can push and pull fluids. It accepts upgrades that can dramatically increase the storage capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest47.des: Create gives you access to your first alloys, though at a poorer ratio than later methods. While good in the early game, you will want to upgrade once you hit &7LV&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest48.des: By putting in a bucket of lava and pumping water in, the Stone Barrel is able to produce you as much cobble as your heart desires. Just be sure to select the correct "ghost circuit", which can be done in the bottom right of the machine's interface.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest49.des: Witch Water can be made in a Wooden Barrel with Mycelium Spores and Water.
Make sure that your Wooden Barrel is on "&n&o&7Barrel Transformation&r" mode. Refer to the Barrel Transformation quest for more information.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest5.desc: Crucibles are handy devices that turn saplings into water, only to be discarded moments later. Using a bucket made of logs, you can magically scoop up this vital liquid.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest50.des: Nickel is a base material used in quite a few alloys. Getting a good amount early on will definitly be beneficial.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest51.des: Using Crushing Wheels, you can automate gravel and sand. Crushing wheels have a set amount of time they need to process their items (based on their RPM), but can process up to a stack of items at a time. Smart Chutes are an easy way to pump a stack of items in at a time.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest52.des: The Questbook takes you through the entire modpack, step by step. Here are a few things you should know:
&5-&r Mechanics: A small chapter explaining some GregTech mechanics
&5-&r Processing Lines: These chapters explain complicated processing lines
&5-&r Line of Progression: This chapter shows you all multiblocks and tiered items such as Coils
&5-&r Resource Production: This chapter shows you how to get MOST of the raw resources you will need
&5-&r Quality of Life: This chapter unveils some helpful mods and features that exist to make the pack more enjoyable
If a Quest doesn't load/register try rejoining.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest53.des: An alternative to the mixer from create.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest54.des: A much needed upgrade to steel production. It's faster, and can be automated!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest55.des: While Tempered Glass is typically made in an Arc Furnace, it can be made in a Stone Barrel with Lava and Glass.
It will be needed to make the Rock Filtrator which is what gates the Arc Furnace.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest56.des: The building-block of any primitive machine.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest59.des: A Primitive Ore Factory upgraded for speed and power.
Not only does it use steam to power over pesky coals but it can perform recipes in parallel using steam.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest6.desc: By sneaking and right-clicking Grass (the dirt one), you can get pebbles for basic stone types.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest60.des: While not required for progression, you'll no longer have to mix and &nTHEN&r smelt. Now it'll be in 1 step.
If you are using steam machines, make sure to check EMI/JEI to see what other you could make use of. They can be quite handy if you dont have &7LV&r machines yet.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest61.des: There are many machines which can use steam to do your desired task even before you have voltage.
Steam can be produced by Boilers either &7Low Pressure&r or &8High Pressure&r.
Alternatively you can use thermal boilers which can be made by right clicking a dynamo with a steam pipe.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest62.des: The literal building bricks to your designs.
Dust to Clay Blocks in a Barrel is a quick and easy solution to all of you masonry pursuits.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest63.des: Larger versions of their single block counter-parts able to make use of steam parallels.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest64.des: Early on you can produce steam using solid fuels like charcoal, liquid fuels like creosote, or &e&lTHE SUN&r &o(only during the day)&r. High Pressure burns faster for higher Steam/tick.
High Pressure and Low Pressure Steam Machines can run most &8ULV&r and &7LV&r recipes at the cost of steam instead of power making them a nice addition to your arsenal.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest67.des: A &o&lMUCH&r better composter that allows you to do thing and bulk with easier automation.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest68.des: The building-block of your first wood oven.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest7.desc: The materials you can acquire from Blackstone are needed to progress. It might be a good idea to automate this.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest70.des: A campfire on steriods for you early &nGlass&r and &nWrought Iron&r needs.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest71.des: A Kiln but now with the power for even easier automation and in mass.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest72.des: While consuming more steam than their earlier counter-parts (if at all), they are able to run multiple of the same recipe at once with no extra cost or time making it a great feature for bulk processing early on.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest73.des: Ever feel like you should be able to build more with effortless building, well consume these to increase your reach.
&4Warning&r: Upgrade can be lost on death or relog in some instances so having some in a chest isn't a horrible idea.

ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest1.descr: Building your first multiblock may seem daunting, but dont fret as theres an easy guide for any multiblock through EMI!
By looking at the uses on a multiblock controller in EMI, you will be shown everyblock needed with the amount alongside a physical display that you can look at layer by layer to help you build it.
Most multiblocks can accept multiple input bus/hatches however there is a minimum to casings a machine needs so if yours isn't forming then try replacing some of them with casing.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest10.desc: EMI/JEI has its own intergration into Greg Tech that allows the user to more easily figure out recipes like,
&5-&r The minimum voltage tier of the recipe being on the bottom right
&5-&r Allowing you to see the speed of the recipe at each voltage tier
&5-&r Showing the speeds for Perfect Overclocking
&5-&r Having a preview of every multiblock in the pack
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest11.desc: Many Greg-Tech machines have a circuit configuration window found on the bottom left of the screen. Each circuit starting from Blank and going up to 32 refers to possible recipes each machine can utilise.
To find the circuit configuration your particular recipe requires Click on the arrow between input items and final product boxes to show uses for the given machine.

If the recipe does not require a circuit or shows blank select the blank circuit. However if your given recipe shows a circuit with an icon number EG; 4, Then in the circuit configuration screen select the same icon circuit
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest12.desc: Some Greg-Tech machines have multiple machine modes that you can swap between with the window found on the left of the screen (UI). Doing this allows 1 machine to swap between multiple task.
The first machine that you'll encounter to do this would be the Wooden Barrel.
Make sure you update the machine when switching modes so recipes can work (taking inputs out and back in does this)
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest13.desc: Parallels are a mechanic where a machine can run multiple of the same recipe at once which dramatically increases the rate at which you can do things. Though how they work is a little funky.
2^(#ofOverclocks) = Time Increase Multiplier of the Recipe
%%amp = %% of an amp the recipe consumes at it's tier, typically this is close to 100%% or 50%% but not always.
#ofOverclocks = The number of voltage tiers your machine's &e&oSpeed&r is above the recipe require voltage.
ParallelHatchSize = Maximum Parallels a Hatch can Perform (4,16,64...)
Parallel Hatches work by consuming the maximum amperage of a tier and using that as a determinate for how many recipes it can run at once (given your parallel hatch is big enough).
Now a common misconception is that putting 2 4a or 2 16a hatches to get 8a and 32a respectively will do anything. It wont. All that does is give machines larger buffer, &4&lNOT&r greater ability.
Another thing to note is that given multiple recipes are ran it takes slightly longer to run but this is worth it in the end since every 4x more parallels nets to 2x more efficeincy.
An equation to calculate the max number of parallels and time increase at any tier is on the &n&oNext Page&r.
Amount of Parallels = min( ParallelCapability , ParallelHatchSize )
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest14.desc: Dreamlinks are a form of wireless power unique to StarT
- Paragon of the Veil: Unlimited Range and Cross-Dimensional
The only form of power Dreamlinks accept are lasers. To produce these, use an active transformer.
To transfer power, you need Dream-link Nodes. These provide a kind of reception, that dream link hatches/covers accept.
By putting your Node and Hatch on the same network, they will share power, just like Flux Networks.
Each new tier of node has better range than the previous one.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest2.descr: If you are running low on resources but want to speed up production, you can use one side of an already exsisting multiblock and build a second one off of it!
You can share almost any blocks in a multiblock as well like coils, and input and output bus/hatches. The item will say if its not allowed to be shared.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest3.descr: Worried your multiblock extruder is going to use the wrong cast? Well theres a feature to stop that!
If you enable distinct buses on every input bus on a multiblock then it will seperate the ingredients thats stored in each one.
This means that if you insert a material into the bus with a certain cast, it can only ever use that cast and never any in other buses.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest3.title: Distinct Busses
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest4.descr: If you put two energy hatches onto a multiblock, it will allow you to "Overclock" the machine to the next voltage tier.
This is used quite a lot in the EBF to give you access to the next voltage tier of material but can be used on almost any other multiblock.
Examples of multiblocks that cannot form with 2 energy hatches is the Circuit and Normal Assembler to not allow progress skipping.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest5.descr: When using a multiblock version of a single block, you have the option to "Perfect Overclock" the machine.
You can access this in the same way as a normal Overclock however it will decrease the processing time even more!
To see the speeds when Perfect Overclocking, do Shift + Left Click on the voltage button on the bottom of the recipe on EMI
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest6.descr: One benefit of gaining access to the Large Chemical Reactor (LCR) is that you now have access to some chemical skips.
Every recipe in this multiblock that uses Circuit 24 will usually only use the base chemicals which will allow you to compact long chemical lines down into a single machine.
A few examples of this is most acids, and liquid epoxy.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest7.descr: Fluid Output hatches have the power to be locked to only accept a certain fluid. This can be useful in multiblocks like the Large Chemical Reactor and the Distilation Tower which usually will have multiple fluids being made in the same machine.
You can use this to have processing lines without fluids going to the wrong machine or the wrong tank and stopping the machine.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest8.descr: Each voltage tier has a cable material that is counted as a super conductor, which means there is no energy loss on a line of cables as well as being able to hold a higher amount of amperage.
&aUEV:&r Ancient Runicalium and Seaborgium Palladium Enriched Estalt Flerovium Alloy
Gregtech also adds it's own superconductors. These however are much harder to craft, and mostly get ignored because of this.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest9.descr: Throughout progression, you may want to check back at older circuit tiers to see if you have gained access to a more efficent recipe.
This could be upgrading from basic components to SMD components or advanced SMD components, or gaining access to a new wafer type that can change the entire recipe.
Not only are these recipes cheaper, but they usually give a much higher quantity per craft for both components AND circuits

Depending on the upgrades installed, you can get more power from a fuel than gregtech generators.

ftbquests.chapter.power.quest14.descript: Higher tier generators can generate much more energy per tick than Thermal Dynamos.
Best for late mid-game and end game.

ftbquests.chapter.power.quest89.descript: The last 2 Solar Panels are merely compressed variants of the previous ones, to allow for more compact solar setups
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest94.descript: Each tier of rotor holder up on top of its inherent &b10%% efficiency bonus&r &7([1-.1] or .9 or 90%% fuel consumption)&r, each tier up doubles consumption and power giving you a &62x energy&r output for 1.8x more fuel. It is always worth it if you can supply enough fuel.
In other words it doubles parallels and give efficiency.

ftbquests.chapter.processing_lines_chap_: Can alternatively be made with basins, see the first chapter for reference.

This recipe is the easiest to make.
This recipe has the least amount of byproducts.
A polymer used to coat materials making them more secure.
A singular &o&dNether Star&r can be broken down into 5 shards. Using this you can more cheaply loop them.
With an Autoclave at &9IV&r, you can higher chances at getting your elemental infused shards by using the nether star shards and energizing them in a Polarizer.
At &4UHV&r you can guarantee infused shards by using energized elemental fluids, which you can get from fusion reactors.
While there are multiple ways to do this, for demonstration purposes this method is shown.

Once you reach the Nether, you can create the most efficient Nether Star line using your &2UIV&r tier autoclave and the nether tempered elemental fluids, where, not only are you guaranteed to get infused shards, but have a chance to get extra!
Sulfuric acid is used in a ton of recipes. Once you have sufficient resource generation, automating this on passive is a must.
Sodalite and Clay electroysis are both great ways to automate this once you have &bMV&r electrolyzers
Processing Ilmenite or Bauxite gives Rutile as byproduct, and you can electrolyze the Bauxite dust or process Ilmenite for more Rutile yield.
By electrolyzing the Purified Debris Dust that you get you are able to obtain the Debris Dust to kick off the processing chain again, thus looping the system.
Electron with Electron yields the most
Muon with Muon yields the most
Tau with Tau yields the most
This entire processing line requires a Sterile Cleanroom
Try using the Aquatic Entangler to automate this. If it is too slow, you can upgrade it with the Upgrade Kits you made before. These increase the amount of fish per catch by quite a bit.

ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest1.descrip: Star Technology is one of the first GregTech Modern packs! Embark on a journey to create many stargates, simulate microuniverses and develop technology!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest10.descri: This works if cheats are enabled. If you don't have them enabled, temporarely enable them before claiming this quest.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest10.title: Turn off AE2 Channels
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest2.descrip: Red screens flash and alarms are going off. Everyone in the room is evacuating. The experiment is a failure. There is little time before this building will explode. But you notice something... the gate ... is opening! You stare in awe and think: "Yes! My theories were right and I figured out what was the problem!". You don't notice the others calling out to you to run. But it was too late. A failure is still a failure and the gate engulfs everything in the room.

You wake up stranded on a floating island in an alternate dimension. The only things you have is a tree and some dirt around it. But you are not discouraged. As the world's greatest scientist you can use these materials to develop technology at faster rate than anyone. You can try once again interdimensional travel. For that you will have to make from almost nothing everything, to develop up to draconic and even star technology. You &oWILL&r succed. You &oWILL&r return home.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest3.descrip: &cALPHA 1&r (Initial Release): Gameplay is in a working state. Theoreticaly it should be able to reach UHV. Done an initial gregification of some mods. No end game content yet.

&cBeta 2&r: Updated Forge version. Added the following mods: Architect's Pallete, 'Dustrial Decor, Simple Discord RPC. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Fixed some langs. Added quests chapter Quality of Life.

&cBeta 2 HOTFIX 1:&r Removed Simple Discord RPC. Fixed soul infused ingots. Made slight modifications to Quality of Life Chapter. Buffed dynamo energy generation. Made dynamo upgrades even cheaper. Added a new panorama.
&cBeta 2 HOTFIX 2:&r Readded vanadium magneite to sieving

&cBeta 3:&r Fixed some typos in quests. Added new quests. Tweaked the color of some casings. Tweaked lumium color. Fixed soul infused ingots recipe in Primitive Alloy Smelter. Added alloy smelter recipe for soul infused ingots. Fixed lithium perchlorate recipe. Fixed saltpeter essence burning in cryptand recipe. Fixed not being able to place blocks in Kinetic Ore Factory's area. Limited colossal chests to 5x5x5. Made nether/end agglomeratio recipes take less time. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory infaltion issue. removed shapeless recipe for bronze and brass. Added magnetite to sieving and ore factories. Increased duration of slime spores production in Large barrel. Modified dynamo upgrades. Added new multiblock Large Stone Barrel for lava, obsidian and pebble production. Fixed netherite sieve upgrade taking HV circuits instead of IV circuits. Added crushed diamond and emerald ore to sieving. Modified create goggle recipes.
Added the following mods: Jet Boots, Pipez, Create New Age, Ender Chests, Ender Tanks, Iris and Oculus Flywheel Compat, NuclearCraft: Neoteric, Daily Dad, Forgiving Void, CraftPresence, Embeddium++.

Removed the following mods: Thermal Dynamics, Automobility, Create Slice 'n' Dice, Create Armory, Ender Storage, Extreme Reactors, Let Sleeping Dogs Lie, Modern UI, Packaged Auto, PackagedExCrafting, Ensorcellation, Corpse.

Updated the following mods: Curios API, Cyclopse Core, Embeddium, FTB Quests, GTCEu Modern, Jade, Kotlin for Forge, ModernFix, Mystical Agriculture, Not Enough Crashes, Supermartijn642's Core Lib, Thermal Extra.

&cBeta 3 HOTFIX1:&r Fixed broken charges recipes. Fixed unreasonable rmps for the Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Added a way to convert NuclearCraft plutonium239 and plutonium241 to their GregTech material. Removed coke to graphite recipe. Buffed chance for nether star essence in its recipe. Changed emerald and diamond crushed ore from string mesh to flint mesh.

&cBeta 3 HOTFIX 2:&r Changed carbon brushes recipe from coke to charcoal. Added Create Diesel Generators to fix the imposibility to make a proper create steam engine. Added recipe for create belts from rubber. Reduced durations of several thermal augments. Added press recipes for some materials. Changed ender pouch recipe from leather to carbon fiber plates.

&cBeta 3 HOTFIX 3:&r Added the mod Foad My F***ing Tags. Fixed several recipes using double plates. Fixed NuclearCraft fuel recipes. Fixed some mystical agriculture recipes. Fixed stirling dynamo recipe.
&cALPHA 1 HOTFIX 1&r: fixed nickel being gated behind LV
&l&bChangelogs after beta 3 are available on the official discord server.&r&r
&cALPHA 1 HOTFIX 2&r: Updated some mods and added red alloy dust recipe

&cALPHA 2:&r Fixed some recipes. Rearanged  and changed some quests. Fixed missing lang names of custom recipe types. Added the tree greenhouse multiblock. Added the primitive alloy smelter. Added the kinetic ore factory. Added some mods like thermal dynamics, thermal systeamics, and simply lights. Overhauled the early game.
&cALPHA 2 HOTFIX 1:&r Added the missing steam dynamo recipe. Fixed the structure of the Tree Green House. Modified the structure of quests.

&cALPHA 3:&r Added the Large Barrel multiblock. Added some quests. Added graphite , fluiduct, windowed fluiduct, servo attachment and turbo servo attachment recipes. Changed crushed blackstone recipe from forge hammer to macerator.
&cALPHA 3 HOTFIX 1:&rFixed missing gravel recipe in forge hammer. Changed sieving gem recipes  from gem to crushed ore.

&cBeta 1:&r Added the following mods: Travel Anchors, Functional Storage, Item Collectors, Carry On. Made dynamos, arc upgrade, mic upgrade and components cheaper.  Buffed the Tree Greenhouse. Slightly nerfed the Extreme Reactors recipes.
&9Stargate 1 content&r: Added 6 new multiblocks. Added recipes related to the first stargate. Added appropriate quests.
